title: Multimodal Instructional Design for Team Game Tactical Communication

context.prior_knowledge: Basic tactical understanding and proficiency in digital device utilization
context.additional_context: Acquisition of tactical instruction delivery skills required for team collaboration in language domains by healthcare/legal/technical field experts

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and apply three tactical instruction conditions (verbal, visual, redundant) in language-based team games.
Learners can select optimal instruction delivery methods according to their expertise level, achieving over 80% accuracy.
Learners can evaluate tactical instruction integration skills in given game scenarios and incorporate peer feedback to improve at least two out of three instances.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
